page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES.1.
page.content: Nolan Harvey. When Mr.Barker was young there were small farms around the area.Few people lived in Boney Hay though there were more living in Chasetown.There were two sandholes(one where the school is now). On the nearby common there were no buildings.The war did not affect Boney Hay,though men who were not miners were sent to war. In the 1940s and 1950s the two main mines were closed.The area was dirty through mine chimnies. People shoped at Chasetown,Cannock or Lichfield.There was only a Co-op at Sankey's corner. Vehicles were coal carts,police were on bicycles and a doctor and a farmer had a car.The colliery had a football team and a brass band. Spare time was spent at the local public house or playing bowls.
